PROLIFIC.Definition: producing a great number of something or having repeated an activity many times

TIED UP.Definition: made them unable to move by tying  a rope or cord around them

WITNESS.Definition: someone who sees an event happening

PIRACY.Definition: the act of attacking ships in order to steal from them

TRIPTYCH.Definition: a piece of art, consisting of 3 panels or parts

PRIVATEER.Definition: someone who was given special permission by the authorities to attack and steal enemy ships

REWARDS.Definition: money given for some special service

GET OUT OF JAIL FREE CARD.Definition: something that is used as an insurance in order to avoid an unpleasant situation, like going to jail. (A reference to the board game Monopoly, in which this card allows players to leave the jail space without missing a turn.)

IMMUNITY.Definition: a situation in which someone is protected from legal action

SENTENCE.Definition: punishment for someone who has been found guilty of a crime by a law court

SENTENCES.Definition: punishment for people who have been found guilty of a crime by a law court

SUBSTITUTE.Definition: the use of something instead of something else

PARTIES.Definition: groups of people who form the different sides of an agreement

COLLATERAL.Definition: something used as security for the payment of a loan

PATRIOTISM.Definition: love and loyalty to one's country

SUPPOSED.Definition: accepted as true by some, but highly doubtful

EYE WITNESSES.Definition: people who saw the event happening

ANXIOUSLY.Definition: in a way that shows worry or nervousness

PASTEL.Definition: a soft coloured material that is used to draw pictures

GETAWAY.Definition: the act of escaping, usually after committing a crime

AUDACITY.Definition: the situation of being fearless and confident in a rude way

TRAP.Definition: a plan for tricking a person into being caught

RANSOM.Definition: a large amount of money that is demanded in exchange for something

UNDERCOVER.Definition: working in secret, using a false appearance

TOOK THE BAIT.Definition: believed them to be true, fell into the trap

THREATENING.Definition: saying that they were going to

DISTRACT.Definition: make them stop giving attention to something

ARTEFACTS.Definition: objects of great historical or cultural value

PRICELESS.Definition: so valuable that its price cannot be calculated or measured

IRREPLACEABLE.Definition: so special that it cannot be replaced

CURATORS.Definition: the people in charge of a museum

DROPOUTS.Definition: people who have left university before having completed their studies

CRAWLED.Definition: moved forward on the hands and knees

DUCT.Definition: a passage that carries air in and out of buildings

ON LOAN.Definition: borrowed for a period of time

COMPENSATION.Definition: money that is paid in exchange for something lost or damaged

NEGOTIATIONS.Definition: a discussion between different groups in order to reach an agreement

PAYOUT.Definition: a large amount of money that is paid

HANDYMAN.Definition: a man whose job is to repair and make things

COVERINGS.Definition: things used to protect something else

RESTORATION.Definition: the process of keeping something to its earlier a good condition

CCTV.Definition: Closed-circuit television, a system of cameras put for security reasons

COOKER.Definition: a large device that is used to cook food

TRUNK.Definition: a large box for storing or keeping things

CURATOR.Definition: the person in charge of the museum
